title: WinSLAMM - Source Loading And Management Model
summary: "The WinSLAMM model is used to identify sources of pollutants in urban stormwater runoff and to evaluate management alternatives for reducing pollutants. USGS studies provide stormwater flow and pollutant-concentration data for calibrating and verifying WinSLAMM for use in Wisconsin." See 'Overview': https://www.usgs.gov/centers/umid-water/science/slamm?qt-science_center_objects=0#qt-science_center_objects Model Name (Name of the model, including acronyms): WinSLAMM - An urban area nonpoint source water-quality model for Wisconsin (Source Loading And Management Model) Model Version (Version of the model, (i.e., 2.0)): Abstract (Description or summary of the model, including its purpose or goals and the type or formalism of the model [...]
body:
"The WinSLAMM model is used to identify sources of pollutants in urban stormwater runoff and to evaluate management alternatives for reducing pollutants. USGS studies provide stormwater flow and pollutant-concentration data for calibrating and verifying WinSLAMM for use in Wisconsin."

See 'Overview': https://www.usgs.gov/centers/umid-water/science/slamm?qt-science_center_objects=0#qt-science_center_objects

Model Name (Name of the model, including acronyms):

WinSLAMM - An urban area nonpoint source water-quality model for Wisconsin (Source Loading And Management Model)

Model Version (Version of the model, (i.e., 2.0)):

Abstract (Description or summary of the model, including its purpose or goals and the type or formalism of the model (e.g., system dynamic, agent based model, machine learning), preferably accompanied by relevant keywords):

"The WinSLAMM model is used to identify sources of pollutants in urban stormwater runoff and to evaluate management alternatives for reducing pollutants. USGS studies provide stormwater flow and pollutant-concentration data for calibrating and verifying WinSLAMM for use in Wisconsin."

See 'Overview': https://www.usgs.gov/centers/umid-water/science/slamm?qt-science_center_objects=0#qt-science_center_objects

References (References (where the model has been cited, outputs, data release):

Selbig, W.R.; Fienen, M.N.; Horwatich, J.A.; Bannerman, R.T. The Effect of Particle Size Distribution on the Design of Urban Stormwater Control Measures. Water 2016, 8, 17. https://doi.org/10.3390/w8010017.

Water Quality, Hydrology, and Response to Changes in Phosphorus Loading of Nagawicka Lake, a Calcareous Lake in Waukesha County, Wisconsin; 2006; SIR; 2006-5273; Garn, Herbert S.; Robertson, Dale M.; Rose, William J.; Goddard, Gerald L.; Horwatich, Judy A. https://doi.org/10.3133/sir20065273.

Sources of phosphorus in stormwater and street dirt from two urban residential basins in Madison, Wisconsin, 1994-95; 1999; WRI; 99-4021; Waschbusch, Robert J.; Selbig, W. R.; Bannerman, Roger T. https://doi.org/10.3133/wri994021.

Sources of contamination in an urban basin in Marquette, Michigan and an analysis of concentrations, loads, and data quality; 1997; WRI; 97-4242; Steuer, Jeffrey; Selbig, William; Hornewer, N. J.; Prey, Jeffrey. https://doi.org/10.3133/wri974242.

Download WinSLAMM: https://www.usgs.gov/software/winslamm

contacts.name: Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources
contacts.description: The Wisconsin Department of Natural Resources (WDNR) is an agency of the state of Wisconsin. Its purpose is to preserve, protect, manage and maintain the natural resources of the state.
